Harpo Jaeger Third-wave pluralist & Senior Leftwing Jewish Malcontent

About Harpo

I'm finishing up a degree in Education History & Policy at Brown University, as well as a self-designed course of study in Politics & Community Organizing. While at Brown, I co-founded a J Street U chapter and an anti-sexual violence task force, as well as working on a number of other on- and off-campus campaigns.

I've written for and was previously on the editorial boards at Jewschool and New Voices Magazine. Aside from that, my main claim to fame is that Marshall Ganz likes my name and we ate grapes together, and a friend once wrote an article about Jews in the Woods that referred to me as a "tie-dye clad student organizer." I think that's pretty cool.
